intro: Dimeria ornithopoda var. yakushimensis, commonly known as the Yakushimen dimeria, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
